item.title: Docs: Stashing Changes
item.description:
Git stash is a tool that lets you stash the changes in a dirty working directory away. See Git’s documentation for more information.

Saving the stash

  1. Open a repository.
  2. Switch to the Status tab.
  3. Tap the box icon in the upper right hand corner.
  4. Tap the Save Stash button.
  5. Your local changes will be saved to the most recent stash.

Restoring the Stash

  1. Open a repository.
  2. Switch to the Status tab.
  3. Tap the box icon in the upper right hand corner.
  4. Tap the Pop Stash button.
  5. Your local directory will be saved to the most recent stash.

Viewing the Stash

  1. Open a repository.
  2. Switch to the Status tab.
  3. Tap the box icon in the upper right hand corner.
  4. Tap the View Stash List button.
  5. Your local directory will be saved to the most recent stash.

item.title: Docs: Keyboard Shortcuts
item.description:
PolyGit supports a wide variety of keyboard shortcuts when connected to an external keyboard. You can view this list in the app’s settings or by holding down the ⌘ key.

General

Name Shortcut
Go Forward ⌘ Ctrl ]
Go Backward ⌘ Ctrl [
New File ⌘ N
New Folder ⌘ Shift N
Import File ⌘ O
Quick Open ⌘ Shift O
Preview ⌘ R
Preview in Safari ⌘ Shift R
Toggle Sidebar ⌘ 0
Switch to Files ⌘ 1
Switch to Status ⌘ 2
Switch to Branches ⌘ 3
Switch to Commits ⌘ 4
Switch to Search ⌘ 5

Text Editing

Name Shortcut
Indent ⌘ ]
Unindent ⌘ [
Move Line Up ⌘ Ctrl ↑
Move Line Down ⌘ Ctrl ↓
Select Word ⌘ D
Select Line ⌘ L
Select All ⌘ A
Find ⌘ F
Find with Selection ⌘ E
Find Next ⌘ G
Find Previous ⌘ Shift G
Increase Font Size ⌘ +
Decrease Font Size ⌘ -

Git

Name Shortcut
Show Pull Page ⌘ Ctrl P
Show Push Page ⌘ Ctrl X
Show Commit Page ⌘ Ctrl C
Stage All ⌘ Ctrl S
Unstage All ⌘ Ctrl S
